question: Mortgage APR vs Rate
Meta_Keywords: best Mortgage APR, Mortgage APR, Best Home APR, Best Home Rate, best Mortgage rate, Mortgage rate
Meta_Description: Mortgage annual percentage rate (APR) is the annual percentage rate for a mortgage loan. It includes points, fees, and other costs of borrowing. Take care when comparing the APRs of adjustable-rate mortgage loans. For adjustable-rate mortgage loans, the APR does not reflect the maximum interest rate of the loan.
content: Mortgage annual percentage rate (APR) is the annual percentage rate for a mortgage loan. It includes points, fees, and other costs of borrowing. The APR reflects the interest rate, any points, mortgage broker fees, and other charges that you pay to get the loan. For that reason, your APR is usually higher than your interest rate.
The mortgage rate is the interest rate charged by the lender to the borrower on a mortgage loan. It does not include points or other costs of borrowing.
If you have applied for a mortgage and received a Loan Estimate from one or more lenders, you can find the interest rate on page 1 under “Loan Terms,” and the APR on page 3 under "Comparisons."

content.sub: Tip: Take care when comparing loan options to be sure you understand any differences between the terms being offered:
subcontent: Take care when comparing the APRs of adjustable-rate mortgage loans. For adjustable-rate mortgage loans, the APR does not reflect the maximum interest rate of the loan.
Be careful when comparing the APRs of fixed-rate loans with the APRs of adjustable-rate loans, or when comparing the APRs of different adjustable-rate loans.

Be careful about comparing the APR of a closed-end loan, which includes fees, to the APR of a home equity line of credit, which doesn’t. Don’t look at the APR alone in determining what loan makes the most sense for your circumstances. Look at this explainer for an example of how interest rates and APRs differ for adjustable-rate loans.
